title: Fulham vs Manchester City LIVE : Premier League team news , line - ups and more
body_text:
Fulham vs Manchester City LIVE: Premier League result, final score and reaction
Follow live coverage as Fulham face Manchester City in the Premier League today.
Manchester City are reigning champions after beating Liverpool to the finish line in a neck-and-neck 2021/22 title race where a comeback win on the final day of the season against Aston Villa secured a fourth title in five years for Pep Guardiola's side.
Jurgen Klopp's Reds were on course for a quadruple last season but were forced to settle for just an FA Cup and Carabao Cup win and will return trying to win the title again just as they did in 2020.
It was a dramatic season for Chelsea a year ago with Roman Abramovich now replaced by Todd Boehly as owner in west London. He will want an instant return on his hefty investment at Stamford Bridge while Tottenham, back in the Champions League, will want to kick on once more too.
It's not all about the action at the top though with Fulham, Bournemouth and Nottingham Forest promoted to the top tier for 2021/22 and hoping to hold their own against the best English football has to offer and avoid the drop.
We will bring you all the action and updates from today's game in the live blog below:
Fulham vs Manchester City LIVE: Premier League updates
FUL XI - Leno, Tete, Ream, Tosin, Robinson, Reed, Palhinha, Andreas, De Cordova-Reid, Vinicius, Wilson
MCI XI - Ederson, Walker, Stones, Dias, Akanji, Rodri, Gundogan, Mahrez, Grealish, Alvarez, Haaland
Goal - Haaland buries a penalty for his 50th of the season (0-1)
Goal - Vinicius equalises after Wilsonâ€™s knock-down (1-1)
Goal - Alvarez curls in a top-corner finish (1-2)
Fulham FC 1 - 2 Manchester City FC

Grealish is unhappy as Tete bundles him over but goes unpunished. He has to be careful. He's on a yellow card.

15:59
There's no way City are going to let Fulham score again now. Guardiola's men don't look flustered at all.

Fulham aren't particularly threatening to score an equaliser now. City are successfully holding them at arm's length.

Silva's the latest City player to earn a free-kick as he gets a rise out of Tete. There'll be at least eight added minutes after Pereira's unfortunate injury earlier.

Cairney gets a free-kick out of Walker. That doesn't worry City too much. The champions are wisely winding down the clock.

Vinicius gets brought down by Rodri. Fulham have been bright all game, but haven't had the quality to trouble City too much.

Fulham are pressing higher up the pitch, making it harder for City to play out from the back. It's a little end-to-end, and Alvarez gets loose to force Leno into another stop at his near post. City corner.

Fulham clear the resulting City corner. If Silva's men want to get anything out of this game, they can't afford to concede the next goal.

City go at half-time with a slender lead thanks to Alvarez's sumptuous strike. The champions have played well overall so far without hitting the heights we all know they can. Fulham will be buoyed by Vinicius' goal though. They're still in this game, without a doubt. More to come!

Grealish is getting plenty of chaces down Fulham's left. Once again Haaland finds the City winger, whose right-footed curler gets caught by Leno.

Akanji's triangular pass frees Grealish down the left. Adarabioyo intercepts and clears the Englishman's cutback from the byline.

City probe in Fulham's half as the hosts hold their shape. They've managed to settle things down a little now.

Fulham are starting to enjoy more of the ball themselves. The West Londoners have only had 32 per cent of it so far.

Grealish almost restores City's lead! Haaland pops the ball over Tete to find the Englishman who goes for the top-right corner with his right foot. Leno makes an excellent diving save to deny him, and City can't smuggle the ball over the line.
